activities:
Personal information collected online and offline in connection with Oracle’s business activities, including information concerning current, prospective and former:  customers; suppliers and vendors; partners;  employees; and in connection with services to Oracle’s customers, access to information concerning our customers’ customers and prospects, suppliers, vendors, partners and employees.  In each case above, the data may include information obtained in connection with merger and acquisition activity, where it may be used for evaluation and integration purposes and for ongoing business management as outlined below.  

Oracle receives information from the EU and Switzerland concerning prospective, current and former employees, consultants, contractors and job applicants for processing and storage. Oracle collects, transfers, and uses this data for purposes of employee benefits and workforce management.  This includes evaluation of qualifications for employment, provision of employment benefits, reporting, security management, administration of compensation, performance management and training, workforce management, budgeting and salary administration, business contact directory, company network access, authentication, personalization and legal compliance.   Oracle maintains separate privacy policies for treatment of employee data and applicant data.

Oracle receives information concerning customers, prospects, partners, vendors and suppliers.  Oracle collects, transfers, and uses this information for a range of business purposes, including marketing and sales, provision of products and services, partner and supply chain management and legal compliance.  Oracle maintains a privacy policy for information it collects in connection with its online and offline business activities. 

In other areas, such as the provision of hardware and software consulting, support, and On Demand/Cloud and other outsourcing services, Oracle acts as a data processor.  When conducting those activities, Oracle holds and/or processes data at the direction of its customer, which acts as a data controller and is responsible for providing notices to and obtaining required consents from data subjects.  Oracle does not control this data and any access to or use of such data is incidental to completing its contractual requirements for the customer.  Oracle maintains a privacy policy in connection with its provision of services to its customers.

For clarity, Oracle’s Safe Harbor certification applies equally to the operations of companies Oracle has acquired over time, such as Peoplesoft, Siebel, Taleo, RightNow and ATG.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Online and Offline Human Resources, Customer, Prospect, Partner, Supplier data; Services Data
recoursemech: TRUSTe Dispute Resolution Program);EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) Panel (for Human Resources Data Only; Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner for Switzerland (FDPIC) - HR Only
